💡 Who I Follow

A list of some favorite bloggers, thought leaders, and Twitter accounts.

Business, Tech, & Entrepreneurship

  • David Perell · @david_perell
    Founder, Write of PassageDavid’s work “…explores how we consume, organize, and share ideas.” He runs an online writing course called Write of Passage, hosts the North Star Podcast, and writes excellent long-form essays.

  • David Senra · @davidsenra1

    Host, Founders Podcast
    David reads biographies of entrepreneurs and offers highlights and anecdotes in a solo podcast format. If it sounds simple, that’s because it is. No interviews, just David dropping knowledge and helping you decide if you want to pick up the book and learn the rest. Half of the shows are free.

  • Jason Fried · @jasonfried
    Founder, BasecampJason and his business partner David Heinemeier Hansson are contrarians in the tech world. They built Basecamp without venture capital investors, and have continued to remain independent for 20 years. They wrote a book about their business philosophy, ReWork, which is on my reading list. I first heard Jason on this episode of David Perell’s podcast. Jason told the the story of Basecamp and fleshed out the company’s healthy and reasonable ethos around productivity. All in all, Jason offers fascinating ideas that I will someday apply to my own company.

  • Sahil Lavingia · @shl
    Founder, GumroadSahil is another tech entrepreneur-turned-investor with great takes on the tech industry.

  • Nathan Barry · @nathanbarry
    Founder, ConvertkitLike David Perell, Nathan is an expert in the craft of building an audience online through writing. This interview with David Perell was fantastic. I find his “Ladders of Wealth Creation” conceot idea especially fascinating.

Finance & Investing

  • Brent Beshore · @brentbeshore
    CEO, Adventur.esBrent’s Twitter feed is a wealth of fascinating ideas. Easily one of the “good guys” of finance.

  • Patrick O’Shaughnessy · @patrick_oshag
    CEO & Portfolio Manager, O’Shaughnessy Asset ManagementHost, Invest Like The Best
    Patrick asks insightful and unexpected questions that draw out the personality of his guests. His is easily one the best (and post popular) business podcasts in existence today.

  • Meb Faber · @mebfaber
    CEO, Cambria InvestmentsHost, The Meb Faber Show
    Meb prides himself on being a contrarian to the investing mainstream. He has compelling thoughts on asset allocation strategies and quantitative factor investing, but presents his ideas in layman’s terms and with plenty of humor. Meb’s whitepapers and free books available on his website.

  • Barry Ritholtz · @ritholtz
    Founder & Chief Investment Officer, Ritholtz Wealth ManagementHost, Masters In Business
    Barry has had some very notable guests on his Bloomberg show. He also writes regularly for Bloomberg and on his blog. He comes prepared with great questions for his guests.

  • Ramp Capital · @rampcapitalllc

    An anonymous Twitter account with hilarious commentary on investing, markets, and current events.

Architecture & Urbanism

  • Wrath of Gnon · @wrathofgnon
    Blogger
    Another anonymous Twitter account. His/her Twitter bio simply reads “Traditionalist.” Wrath constantly shares the beauty and wisdom of bygone ages, especially in the development of towns and cities. Wrath will quickly convince you that the automobile ruined our cities.

  • Erik Bootsma · @ErikBootsma
    Architect, Bootsma DesignErik is a classical architect who is very active on Twitter.

  • Chistopher Liberatos · @CharlestonArchi
    Architect
    Charleston, SC
    Another classical architect who is very active on Twitter.

  • R. John Anderson · @johnthebad
    Real Estate Developer/Builder/Urban Designer, AndersonKim Architecture + Urban DesignR. John is an urbanist raconteur who puts his money where his mouth is. He is an expert in small-scale urban development projects and has decades of experience dealing with zoning laws, parking requirements, and city councils to get beautiful places built on a small scale. John is the only person on this list (other than my wife) that I’ve met in person. His energy and wit are infectious and he is a wealth of knowledge on getting things built. John is active with the Incremental Development Alliance, a nonprofit dedicated to helping individuals learn the process of thoughtful redevelopment.

  • Charles Marohn · @clmarohn
    Founder & President, Strong TownsChuck Marohn is a visionary who has dedicated his career to changing how human beings build their cities.

  • Johnny Sanphillippo
    Blogger, Granola Shotgun

Artists

  • J. C. Scharl · @jcscharl
    Poet, Author, Critic, (Self-Employed)My wife. She has published numerous poems and critical works is currently working on a novel, The Dream Interpreter.

  • A. E. Stallings · @ae_stallings
    Poet
    Athens, Greece

  • Jane Greer · @NorthDakotaJane
    Poet
    Bismarck, ND

  • Maryann Corbett · @Saint Paul, MN
    Poet
    Saint Paul, MN

  • AlexanderPiano
    Pianist
    Alex posts wonderful piano recordings on his YouTube channel.
